blackdoor.util

Class CommandLineParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • blackdoor.util.CommandLineParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class CommandLineParser
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    CommandLineParser is a ... command line parser. CLP offers GNU-like help menus and option syntax.

    To help understand methods and variables in this class the following definitions are given:

    An argument is anything in the command line after the program name.

    An parameter is an argument not specified by an option.

    An option is a one letter or one word indicator (preceded by one or two dashes, respectively.) that can be on it's own, or be followed by whitespace and then a value.

    A value is used to define some attribute in the command line, and is typically preceded by and associated with an option.

    e.g. in "wget --output index.html -t 5 google.com/file.txt" "output" and "t" are options, "index.html" and "5" are the values of "output" and "t" respectively, while "google.com/file.txt" is the value of a parameter. Everything in the string is an argument, except "wget" which is the program name.

    Author:
    nfischer3
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommandLineParser

        public CommandLineParser()
        Creates a new CommandLineParser. Different arguments and options can be defined for this parser, once configured the parser can handle multiple argument strings with the same configuration.

    • Method Detail

      • getParsedArgs

        @Deprecated
public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getParsedArgs(java.lang.String[] args)
                                                                            throws CommandLineParser.InvalidFormatException
        Deprecated. 
        Get the parsed and checked command line arguments for this parser
        Parameters:
        args - - The command line arguments to add. These can be passed straight from the parameter of main(String[])

        Returns:
        A list of strings, the first([0]) element in each list is the command line option, if the second([1]) element exists it is the parameter for that option.

        Returns null if parseArgs(String[]) has not been called.

        Throws:
        CommandLineParser.InvalidFormatException

      • parseArgs

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,CommandLineParser.Argument> parseArgs(java.lang.String[] args)
                                                                     throws CommandLineParser.InvalidFormatException
        Parse arguments from the command line into a map of Argument objects.
        Parameters:
        args - An array of Strings passed to main from the command line.
        Returns:
        A map of Argument objects, if an argument had a long form then that is the key, otherwise the short form is the key.
        Throws:
        CommandLineParser.InvalidFormatException - Thrown if the command line is not in a valid format or if a required argument is missing, or if a required value is missing from an argument, etc...

      • getHelpText

        public java.lang.String getHelpText()
        Get a GNU-like help text output. This should be displayed when the options -h, --help are entered, or when an invalid command line is entered.
        Returns:
        GNU-like help output.

      • addArguments

        @Deprecated
public void addArguments(java.lang.String[] argList)
                               throws CommandLineParser.DuplicateOptionException,
                                      CommandLineParser.InvalidFormatException
        Deprecated. 
        adds options for this command line parser
        Parameters:
        argList - a list of Strings of options in a comma separated format

        single char options should be prepended with a single "-"

        string options should be prepended with "--"

        non-option parameters should add a "?" to the string. non-option parameters should define the string (long/--) form option.

        ie. parameters that would not have an explicit option before them

        eg. cp source.txt dest.txt

        to add helptext for this option, add -h followed by the help text

        if there MUST be a parameter after this command line option then add a "+" to the string. alternatively if there MAY be a parameter after this command line option then add a "*" to the string

        eg. "-r,--readonly" or "--file,-f,+" or "*, -f, --flag, -h this is helptext" or "--source, ?"

        Throws:
        CommandLineParser.DuplicateOptionException
        CommandLineParser.InvalidFormatException

      • addArgument

        @Deprecated
public void addArgument(java.lang.String argumentString)
                              throws CommandLineParser.DuplicateOptionException,
                                     CommandLineParser.InvalidFormatException
        Deprecated. 
        Add a single option to this command line parser. Convenience method for calling addFlags with only one option
        Parameters:
        argumentString - - formatted string for this command line option, should be in same format as strings in addOptions(String[])
        Throws:
        CommandLineParser.DuplicateOptionException
        CommandLineParser.InvalidFormatException

      • addArgument

        @Deprecated
public void addArgument(char shortForm,
                                     java.lang.String longForm,
                                     java.lang.String helpText,
                                     boolean isParameter,
                                     boolean takesValue,
                                     boolean valueRequired)
                              throws CommandLineParser.DuplicateOptionException
        Deprecated. 
        Add an argument for this command line parser. Options should not be prepended by dashes.
        Parameters:
        shortForm - Single character command line option
        longForm - String command line option
        helpText - Help text to show after the short and long form in getHelpText()
        isParameter - True if this argument is a parameter and will not be preceded by an option
        valueRequired - True if the user MUST enter a value for this argument.
        takesValue - Should be true if this option may followed by a value when called from the command line.
        Throws:
        CommandLineParser.DuplicateOptionException - Thrown if this parser already has an option with the same short or long form.

      • addArgument

        public void addArgument(CommandLineParser.Argument arg)
                 throws CommandLineParser.DuplicateOptionException
        Add an argument for this command line parser.
        Parameters:
        arg - The Argument object to add to this parser
        Throws:
        CommandLineParser.DuplicateOptionException - Thrown if this parser already has an option with the same short or long form.

      • addArguments

        public void addArguments(CommandLineParser.Argument[] args)
                  throws CommandLineParser.DuplicateOptionException
        Convenience method to add arguments from an array. Same as calling addArgument(Option) on every element in args.
        Parameters:
        args - Array of Arguments to add for this CommandLineParser.
        Throws:
        CommandLineParser.DuplicateOptionException - Thrown if this parser already has an option with the same short or long form as one of the objects you are trying to add.
